Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 21st overall pick, by New Jersey in 1975...
Traded from New Jersey to Northeastern on 2/12/1975 (Going to NE: P D. Turner, P J. Bostic. Going to NJ: P B. Manwaring)...
Injured on 5/24/1975 with a Ruptured Bicep Tendon, out for 3-4 weeks...
Earned first career win on 9/12/1977...
Had first career hit (double) on 10/3/1977, off Ray Barnett (WIS)...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/1/1981, winning 2 games with a 0.00 ERA...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/29/1986, winning 2 games with a 0.68 ERA...
